content.text:
# Feature Enhancements

ElizaOS has received numerous feature enhancements in recent updates:

- Added default logger level setting capability (PR #2451)
- Created version.cmd for Windows support (PR #2442)
- Enhanced the Solana Agent Kit with new features (PR #2458)
- Added tests for Instagram client (PR #2454)
- Integrated Pyth Data Plugin (PR #2434)
- Updated Heurist environment variable examples (PR #2428)
- Added contributor meeting notes for 2025-01-14 (PR #2426)
- Implemented workflow to block minified JS (PR #2417)
- Improved logging functionality (PR #2396)
- Added Code In Plugin to load characters from blockchain (PR #2371)
- Enabled IBC transfers on Cosmos blockchains (PR #2358)
- Enhanced Telegram autonomous agent with extra multimedia support (PR #2338, #2510)
- Integrated Coinbase AgentKit plugin (PR #2298)
- Added Livepeer LLM provider integration (PR #2154)
- Implemented Injective plugin (PR #1764)
- Added support for Sui's secp256k1/secp256r1 algorithms (PR #2476)
- Enabled loading multiple characters from a single remote URL (PR #2475)
- Added test configuration for Binance plugin (PR #2482)
- Enhanced Solana plugin for flawless transfers (PR #2340)
- Improved Discord autonomous agent (PR #2335)
- Introduced Dependency Injection to enhance developer experience (PR #2115)

# Bug Fixes

Several bugs have been addressed in recent updates:

- Fixed incorrect Tweet ID parameter passed to sendTweet function (PR #2430)
- Fixed OPENAI provider being overwritten by LLAMA_LOCAL on pnpm start (PR #2465)
- Resolved type error for children in animated.div component (PR #2462)
- Fixed various typos and spelling errors in documentation and code (PRs #2464, #2456, #2449, #2447)
- Updated error message and removed duplicate version field (PR #2445)
- Fixed missing import issue (PR #2444)
- Updated Zero Gravity (0G) link (PR #2441)
- Resolved quickstart.md conflicts (PR #2437)
- Fixed typos in Supabase seed file (PR #2435)
- Added default port 3000 when VITE_SERVER_PORT is not defined (PR #2433)
- Fixed TEE Log plugin errors at agent startup (PR #2415)
- Fixed conditional use of useQuery in AgentRoute component (PR #2413)
- Fixed image description issue (PR #2375)
- Corrected SwapAction in evm-plugin (PR #2332)
- Fixed linting errors (PR #2474)

# Testing and Documentation

Improvements to testing and documentation include:

- Added test configuration and tests for Redis adapter (PR #2470)
- Added tests for Supabase and SQLite DB adapters (PR #2468)
- Added test handling in version.sh file (PR #2485)
- Updated documentation links (PR #2438, #2495)
- Reverted "dockerize smoke tests" (PR #2459)
- Added OpenAI environment to smoke tests (PR #2472)

# Other Changes

Other notable changes include:

- Set OpenAI as the default character provider (PR #2460)
- Removed Tate character (PR #2425)
- Replaced ESLint, Prettier, and TSLint with Biome (PR #2439)
- Updated createToken.ts (PR #2493)
- Corrected banner links (PRs #2491, #2490, #2489, #2483)

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several technical issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering a range of problems across different platforms and functionalities:

1. Connection and timeout issues:
   - Anthropic 504 Timeout (Issue #2414)
   - MacOS Eliza Client connection problems, cycling between "Connecting" and "Disconnected" states (Issue #2471)

2. Installation and compatibility problems:
   - Docker container issues on M-based Mac, with missing module '@anush008/tokenizers-linux-arm64-gnu' (Issue #2432)
   - WSL 2 onnxruntime package errors (Issue #2478)
   - Error when using <QueryClientProvider /> component (Issue #2416)

3. Functionality and implementation concerns:
   - Unexpected JSON metadata appearing in Twitter bot replies (Issue #2423)
   - CACHE_STORE environment variable not being used in database/index.ts file (Issue #2511)

4. Feature requests and documentation needs:
   - Request for documentation on the implemented RagKnowledge feature (Issue #2484)
   - Suggestion to make Twitter agents interact more naturally in Twitter Spaces (Issue #2488)
   - Request to add timeout test coverage for Binance plugin price service (Issue #2486)

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the Eliza Project

content.text:
The Eliza project has seen several significant pull requests recently, focusing on new features, bug fixes, and code improvements:

- A new Pyth Data Plugin has been added (PR #2434)
- A fix for the OPENAI provider being overwritten by LLAMA_LOCAL on pnpm start (PR #2465)
- Documentation improvements for plugins (PR #2419)
- Code quality improvements with the replacement of eslint, prettier, and tslint with biome (PR #2439)
- Introduction of Dependency Injection to enhance developer experience (PR #2115)
- Enhanced multimedia support for the Telegram client (PR #1837)
- Test configuration and coverage for the Binance plugin (PR #2482)
- Additional development work in PR #2443 (Platinum dev no148)

Current cryptocurrency prices show significant variations between earlier and more recent data points:

- WETH: Price increased from $3,307.37 to $3,474.90, showing a 5.1% gain
- SOL: Price rose from $211.06 to $219.53, representing a 4.0% increase
- WBTC: Price climbed from $99,785.18 to $103,827.94, a 4.1% increase
- ai16z: Price decreased from $1.32 to $1.16, showing a 12.1% decline

While the major cryptocurrencies (WETH, SOL, WBTC) all showed positive price movement, the smaller token ai16z experienced a notable decrease in value.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed significant activity over a two-day period. From January 17-18, 2025, there were 45 new pull requests with 37 merged, 16 new issues created, and 73 active contributors. Activity decreased slightly on the following day (January 18-19, 2025) with 27 new pull requests (20 merged), 9 new issues, and 42 active contributors. Overall, the project maintained strong development momentum with consistent contributions and issue management across both days.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary of the top contributors to the elizaOS/eliza repository.
